page.title: 15ATTITUDES IN HINXWORTH
page.content: A TEENAGER'S VIEW:These villages are very picturesque but they offer nothing for the teenage population - all 6 of us! There are no discos or evening classes and to have any entertainment one has to go to the nearest town 6 miles away usually taken & collected by parents. The compensations are plenty of baby- sitting for pocket money, knowing everybody, no factories, no pollution except the odd farm smell! HOUSEWIFE:This is an ideal environment in which to bring up children; it is peaceful and quiet and well away from the temptations of the towns. The major drawback is that transport is absolutely essential, but that apart it is a friendly and caring community. WORKING ADULT:The disadvantage is hav- ing to commute but the advantages of living in the country outweigh this.
